casebody.data:
The CONNECTICUT MUTUAL LIFE INSURANCE COMPANY OF HARTFORD, CONNECTICUT, a Connecticut Corporation, Appellant, v. Marie V. HERRMANN, Appellee. No. 7132. Circuit Court of Appeals, Sixth Circuit. Jan. 12, 1937. Miller, Canfield, Paddock & Stone, of Detroit, Mich., for appellant. Jeffries, Krause & Hally, of Detroit, Mich., for appellee.

Before MOORMAN, HICKS, and ALLEN, Circuit Judges.

*997PER CURIAM.

It appearing that the evidence in this cause was not sufficient to authorize the trial court to direct the jury to return a verdict for the appellee,

It is ordered that the judgment be reversed and the cause remanded for a new trial.
